text: India has demanded the release of a
fighter pilot shot down by Pakistani
warplanes during a clash in the skies
over Kashmir video showing the pilot
blindfolded and with blood on his face
was shared by Pakistan's Information
Ministry India described the images as a
vulgar display of an injured personnel
while Pakistan claims to have shot down
two Indian aircraft after its own
warplanes carried out strikes in
indian-administered Kashmir that
followed Indian air strikes which India
says targeted militants based in
Pakistan who had killed dozens of people
in Indian territory from Islamabad
Secunda Kimani reports these are
Pakistani soldiers apparently leading
away a downed Indian pilot with an angry
crowd behind them the Pakistani military
says his plane was shot down as India
scrambled to respond to Pakistani
strikes across the border in the
disputed region of Kashmir Pakistan new
Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan said
the military force was a response to
earlier Indian aggression but also
called for dialogue between the
nuclear-armed neighbors mera saaya

the Indian government is given the arms
that we both have can we afford any
miscalculation we should be thinking
that if this escalates where will it
lead certainly I'm very nervous about
both countries going to war with each
other they're both nuclear countries for
now there's been no talk of a nuclear
escalation and I think the escalation
will remain conventional in nature but
it does seem that Prime Minister Modi
has sort of news prime minister of non
Khan's
offers for talks and so we'll just have

was detected and the Indian Air Force

the fear is the violence can now
